raw_text:
Scots suffer another injury blow
 
 Scotland's back row crisis has worsened ahead of the RBS Six Nations with news that Scott Gray will miss out on the opening matches.
 
 The Borders flanker has a knee injury and joins Donnie Macfadyen and Allister Hogg on the sidelines. Star number eight Simon Taylor will miss at least the first two games after damaging an ankle during his comeback. Scott MacLeod (ankle ligaments) and Jon Petrie (cartilage) are also doubtful for the opener in Paris on 5 February. Gray, 26, who won his first cap against Australia at Murrayfield last year, was hurt in club action at the weekend. Scotland doctor James Robson said: "A scan has shown damage to the medial ligaments of Scott's right knee ruling him out of the first part of the Championship. "We will seek further specialist advice in due course to determine just how long Scott may be out for." Another potential option, Glasgow flanker Andrew Wilson, has been ruled out for a month after damaging ligaments in both knees against Northampton recently.
 
 Flanker Jason White and prop Tom Smith have also been suffering from flu and missed this week's training sessions. "We have got plenty of good, young players coming through and we have got to look at the opportunities it represents for them, rather than the negatives," Williams added. Williams could now turn to Edinburgh pair Alasdair Strokosch and Simon Cross. Leeds Tykes flanker Jon Dunbar also trained with the squad but is still awaiting verification of his eligibility to qualify for Scotland.
llama3.2:1b: Scotland's back row will be without Scott Gray due to a knee injury, and other players may miss opening matches in the RBS Six Nations. Simon Taylor has damaged an ankle, while Scott MacLeod and Jon Petrie are doubtful for at least two games.
llama3.2:3b: Scotland's back row crisis worsened ahead of the RBS Six Nations, with Scott Gray (knee injury), Donnie Macfadyen (ankle ligaments), Allister Hogg (ankle ligaments), and Jon Petrie (cartilage) joining Scott MacLeod (ankle ligaments) in doubt for the opener. Star number eight Simon Taylor will miss at least two games with an ankle injury, while Andrew Wilson is out for a month with knee ligament damage. Flanker Jason White and prop Tom Smith also missed training sessions due to flu.

Andrew Wilson has also been ruled out for a month due to knee injury. Other players are dealing with flu and may miss training sessions.

Additionally, star number eight Simon Taylor is out for the first two games due to an ankle injury, while other players like Scott MacLeod (ankle ligaments), Jon Petrie (cartilage), and Andrew Wilson are also questionable or unavailable. Jason White and Tom Smith have also had knee injuries and missed training sessions this week. Alasdair Strokosch and Simon Cross could potentially return with their eligibility verified in Edinburgh.

Simon Taylor faces at least two games after an ankle injury. Scott MacLeod and Jon Petrie are also doubtful for the Paris opener on 5 February. Andrew Wilson will miss a month with ligament damage in both knees. Flankers Jason White and Tom Smith have flu, and Glasgow flanker Andrew Wilson is unavailable. Williams could turn to Edinburgh players Alasdair Strokosch and Simon Cross or Leeds Tykes flanker Jon Dunbar for the match.

Scots suffer another injury blow. Scotland's back row is struggling ahead of the Six Nations with Scott Gray out for the opening match on 5 February, having a knee injury. flankers Simon Taylor and Scott MacLeod will miss at least game one due to an ankle injury. Andrew Wilson, who suffered knee injuries against Northampton, has also been ruled out for a month. Jason White and Tom Smith have both missed training sessions with flu. Jon Dunbar is still with the squad but hasn't been verified yet.
tinyllama:1.1b: Scott Gray, a star back row, has suffered an injury and will miss the opening games of the RBS Six Nations due to a knee injury. The team's back row comprising Allister Hogg, Simon Taylor, Donnie MacFaedy, and Jon Petrie are all doubtful for the first two matches in Paris on 5 February due to various injuries. Glasgow prop Tom Smith is also suffering from flu and has missed training sessions this week. Flanker Jason White and prop Tom Smith have been struggling with flu and will be available for selection in future games, while Edinburgh pair Alasdair Strickerc and Simon Cross are now expected to join the squad. Meanwhile, Scotland doctor James Robson revealed that another potential option, Glasgow flake Andrew Wilson, has suffered from flu and missed training sessions recently. The team is expected to turn towards a mix of experienced players like Leeads Tykes pair Alasdair Strickerc and Simon Cross, who are awaiting verification of their eligibility for Scotland, in the absence of Gray.

The Borders flanker suffered an ankle injury during his comeback, while his teammates Simon Taylor and Donnie MacFadyen are also sidelined with injuries. Scottish captain Jim Hamilton has said he will seek advice from specialists in Glasgow regarding Gray's potential absence. Edinburgh props Alasdair Strokosch and Simon Cross, as well as Leeds Tykes flanker Jon Dunbar, have yet to receive confirmation of their eligibility for Scotland.
